pages.text: The effects of $(item)ruby$() immediately manifested themselves through my physical being.$(br2)The armor that I forged from it filled my veins with a seizing anger, and compels me to $(thing)kill$().

I felt myself become stronger and more constituted in combat, like I myself could $(thing)sustain more attacks$() and keep fighting.$(br2)However, the rage that emboldened me couldn’t distract from the dread that resided in the back of my mind while I wore the ruby.$(br2)I don’t like how it feels, but I want to wear it again...

Whereas $(l:innovation/metallurgy/diamond)diamond$() preserved itself by slowly mending its own wounds, $(item)ruby$() seemed to have a desire to preserve me above itself, slowly healing my own wounds.
